com.precog.client

Class PrecogClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.precog.client.PrecogClient

  • public class PrecogClient
extends Object
    A simple REST client for storing data in Precog and querying it with Quirrel.

    This provides methods to upload files to your virtual file system (in Precog), append records/events to the VFS, delete data, and run Quirrel queries on your data. Additionally, you can also create new accounts and get the account details for existing accounts.

    All methods are blocking, which means that the method returns when the server has replied with the answer.

    Author:
    Kris Nuttycombe , Tom Switzer

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrecogClient

        public PrecogClient(URL service,
            String apiKey,
            String accountId,
            String basePath)
        Builds a new client to connect to precog services.
        Parameters:
        service - service to connect
        apiKey - api key to use
        accountId - the account to use as the data owner
        basePath - The base path to use for all requests

      • PrecogClient

        public PrecogClient(URL service,
            String apiKey,
            String accountId)
        Builds a new client to connect to precog services. This will use the accountId as the base path getBasePath() for all queries. If this is not desired, you must construct the PrecogClient with a base path explicitly.

        This is equivalent to calling: new PrecogClient(service, apiKey, accountId, accountId).

        Parameters:
        service - service to connect
        apiKey - api key to use
        accountId - the account to use as the data owner

      • PrecogClient

        public PrecogClient(URL service,
            String apiKey)
        Builds a new client to connect to precog services. This attempts to determine the data owner (on ingest/append/upload) from the API key. This may fail and cause the related methods to throw an exception. If this is not desired, then use a constructor that let's you use one of the account IDs.

        The base path in this case is assumed to be "/".

        Parameters:
        service - service to connect
        apiKey - api key to use

      • PrecogClient

        public PrecogClient(URL service,
            AccountInfo account)
        Construct a new PrecogClient using the API key of the given account, the account ID of the account as the data owner, and the account root path as the base path.
        Parameters:
        service - the Precog end-point to use
        account - the account to base this client off of

      • PrecogClient

        public PrecogClient(String apiKey,
            String accountId,
            String basePath)
        Builds a new client to connect to precog services.

        This constructor uses the Precog beta end-point (beta.precog.com). If you wish to use a different end point, use PrecogClient(URL, String, String, String).

        Parameters:
        apiKey - api key to use
        accountId - the account to use as the data owner
        basePath - The base path to use for all requests
        See Also:
        PrecogClient(URL, String, String, String), BETA_HTTPS

This may fail and cause the related methods to throw an exception. If this is not desired, then use a constructor that let's you use one of the account IDs.

        The base path in this case is assumed to be "/".

      • createAccount

        public static AccountInfo createAccount(URL service,
                        String email,
                        String password)
                                 throws HttpException
        Creates a new account ID, accessible by the specified email address and password, or returns the existing account ID. You must provide a service that uses HTTPS to use this service, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        service - the Precog service to use
        email - user's email
        password - user's password
        Returns:
        Json string with the account Id
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not secure (HTTPS)

      • createAccount

        public static AccountInfo createAccount(String email,
                        String password)
                                 throws HttpException
        Creates a new account ID, accessible by the specified email address and password, or returns the existing account ID. This just calls createAccount(URL,String,String) with a default service of BETA_HTTPS.
        Parameters:
        email - user's email
        password - user's password
        Returns:
        Json string with the account Id
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not secure (HTTPS)

                          String email,
                          String password,
                          String accountId)
                                   throws HttpException

        email - user's email
        password - user's password
        accountId - account's id number
        Returns:
        account info
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not secure (HTTPS)

        password - user's password

                                 throws HttpException
        Appends all the events in contents, a string whose Format is described by format, to path in the virtual file-system.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • appendAllFromFile

        public AppendResult appendAllFromFile(String path,
                             File file,
                             Format format)
                               throws HttpException
        Appends all the events in contents, a file whose Format is described by format, to path in the virtual file-system.

        For instance, to ingest a CSV file, you could do something like: 

         PrecogClient precog = new Precog(myApiKey, myAccountId);
 File csvFile = new File("/path/to/my.csv");
 precog.appendAllFromFile(file.getName(), file, CsvFormat.CSV);
        Parameters:
        path - the path in Precog to ingest the data into
        file - the data file to ingest
        format - the format of the data
        Returns:
        the results of the ingest
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • appendAllFromInputStream

        public AppendResult appendAllFromInputStream(String path,
                                    InputStream in,
                                    Format format)
                                      throws HttpException
        Appends all the events in contents, an InputStream whose Format is described by format, to path in the virtual file-system.

        This will use chunked-encoding for the HTTP stream, so is suitable for large InputStreams.

        Parameters:
        path - the path in Precog to ingest the data into
        in - the data as an InputStream to ingest
        format - the format of the data
        Returns:
        the results of the ingest
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • append

        public AppendResult append(String path,
                  Object obj)
                    throws HttpException
        Store the object obj as a record in Precog. It is serialized by Gson using reflection. If a Gson object was provided during construction, then it will be used, otherwise the default Gson serialization will be used.

        Note: Calling this method guarantees the object is stored in the Precog transaction log.

        Parameters:
        path - The path in the virtual file system to store the record
        obj - The object to serialize to JSON and store in the VFS
        Throws:
        HttpException - if there is a network error or unexpected results

      • appendAll

        public <T> AppendResult appendAll(String path,
                         Iterable<T> coll)
                       throws HttpException
        Append a collection of records in Precog.
        Parameters:
        path - the sub-path to store the records in
        coll - the collection of records to store
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • append

        public <T> AppendResult append(String path,
                      T obj,
                      ToJson<T> toJson)
                    throws HttpException
        Store the object obj as a record in Precog. It is serialized by using ToJson.serialize(Object) on toJson.

        Note: Calling this method guarantees the object is stored in the Precog transaction log.

        Parameters:
        path - The path in the virtual file system to store the record
        obj - The object to serialize to JSON and store in the VFS
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • uploadFile

        public AppendResult uploadFile(String path,
                      File file,
                      Format format)
                        throws HttpException
        Uploads the records in file to path. This is equivalent to first deleting the data at the VFS path path, then calling appendAllFromFile(String,File,Format).
        Parameters:
        path - the path in Precog to upload the data to
        file - the data file to upload
        format - the format of the file's contents
        Returns:
        the results of the data ingest
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

        public Path buildStoragePath(Path path)
        Builds a data storage path from a given path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path at which the record should be placed in the virtual file system.
        Returns:
        full path

      • delete

        public void delete(String path)
            throws HttpException
        Deletes the data stored at the specified path. This does NOT do a recursive delete. It'll only delete the data the path specified, all other data in sub-paths of path will remain in-tact.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to delete data from
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • query

        public QueryResult query(String path,
                String q)
                  throws HttpException
        Executes a synchronous query relative to the specified base path. The HTTP connection will remain open for as long as the query is evaluating (potentially minutes).

        Not recommended for long-running queries, because if the connection is interrupted, there will be no way to retrieve the results of the query.

        Parameters:
        path - relative storage path to query
        q - quirrel query to excecute
        Returns:
        result as Json string
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • query

        public QueryResult query(String q)
                  throws HttpException
        Executes a synchronous query relative to the specified base path. The HTTP connection will remain open for as long as the query is evaluating (potentially minutes).

        Not recommended for long-running queries, because if the connection is interrupted, there will be no way to retrieve the results of the query.

        Parameters:
        q - quirrel query to excecute
        Returns:
        result as Json string
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • queryAsync

        public Query queryAsync(String path,
               String q)
                 throws HttpException
        Runs an asynchronous query against Precog. An async query is a query that simply returns a Job ID, rather than the query results. You can then periodically poll for the results of the job/query.

        This does NOT run the query in a new thread. It will still block the current thread until the server responds.

        An example of using queryAsync(String) to poll for results could look like: 

         PrecogClient precog = ...;
 Query query = precog.queryAsync("foo/", "min(//bar)"); 
 QueryResult result = null;
 while (result == null) {
     result = precog.queryResults(query);
 }
 Double min = Double.valueOf(result.data.get(0));
 println("Minimum is: " + min);

        This is ideal for long running queries.

        Parameters:
        path - the base path to use in the query
        q - the query to execute
        Returns:
        a Job ID that can be used with queryResults(Query)
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • queryAsync

        public Query queryAsync(String q)
                 throws HttpException
        Runs an asynchronous query against Precog. An async query is a query that simply returns a Job ID, rather than the query results. You can then periodically poll for the results of the job/query.
        Throws:
        HttpException
        See Also:
        queryAsync(String, String)

      • queryResults

        public QueryResult queryResults(Query query)
                         throws HttpException
        This polls Precog for the completion of an async query. If the query has completed, then a QueryResult object is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        query - the query, as returned by queryAsync(String,String)
        Returns:
        the results if the query completed, null otherwise
        Throws:
        HttpException - if the server sends an unexpected response

      • downloadQueryResults

        public boolean downloadQueryResults(Query query,
                           File file)
                             throws IOException,
                                    HttpException
        Downloads the results of a query to a file. This will block until the query has completed and results are ready.

        This will stream the results to the file, so it is suitable for working with very large result sets.

        If the query has any errors (or server errors), then false will be returned. Otherwise, the query results will be downloaded to the File file and true will be returned.

        Parameters:
        query - the async query to download the results from
        file - the file to store the results in
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file already exists or there is an error writing to file
        HttpException - if there are any network problems or the server returns an unexpected result
